These symptoms are mainly due to the high blood calcium levels that result from excessive PTH.",NIDDK,Primary Hyperparathyroidism
How to diagnose Primary Hyperparathyroidism ?,"Health care providers diagnose primary hyperparathyroidism when a person has high blood calcium and PTH levels. High blood calcium is usually the first sign that leads health care providers to suspect parathyroid gland overactivity. Other diseases can cause high blo
